text: was a Japanese football player. He played for the Japan national team. ==Biography== Kato was born on January 2, 1920. After graduating from Tokyo Imperial University, he joined Tanabe Pharmaceutical in 1947. In March 1951, when Kato was 31 years old, he was selected the Japan national team for Japan team first game after World War II, 1951 Asian Games. At this competition, on March 9, he debuted against Afghanistan. ==Statistics== Japan National Football Team Database |- |1951||1||0 |- !Total||1||0 |} ==References== ==Other websites== * Category:1920 births Category:Year of death missing Category:Japanese footballers Category:Japan international footballers Category:Tanabe Mitsubishi Pharma SC players
title: Nobuyuki Kato
